intro: Chlidanthus ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads, which are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Chlidanthus ehrenbergii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
